results.headline: A Girl and Her Much Nicer Horse
results.summary_short: In “The Greening of Whitney Brown,” a brat falls on hard times and falls for a horse.

results.headline: The Making of the French President
results.summary_short: “The Conquest,” a fictionalized movie of the rise of Nicolas Sarkozy to the French presidency, zeroes in on his struggle for personal power.

results.headline: An Aging Loser Gets the Girl(s)
results.summary_short: “A Novel Romance” centers on a middle-aged schlub and the attractive young women he inexplicably attracts.

results.headline: Thwarting Paparazzi and Thugs
results.summary_short: In William Monahan’s directorial debut, Colin Farrell plays a bodyguard (to a movie star played by Keira Knightley) whose underworld connections want him back.

results.headline: It’s Dark, Twisted and Unexplainable
results.summary_short: In “Immortals,” gods and men act very, very badly.

results.headline: A Violinist Brought to Life by His Students
results.summary_short: “God’s Fiddler: Jascha Heifetz” tells the story of one of the greatest musicians of the 20th century.

results.headline: In This Version of Rio, Violence and Gore Are All in a Day’s Work
results.summary_short: “Elite Squad: The Enemy Within,” José Padilha’s action thriller, depicts a Brazil writhing with drug violence and corruption.

results.headline: Escaping Nosy Parents, and the Morality Police, Too
results.summary_short: In “Dog Sweat,” surreptitiously filmed in Tehran, young Iranians are in love and in revolt.

results.headline: Going Over the Top, Then Downhill
results.summary_short: Now that Adam Sandler, the star of “Jack and Jill,” has settled into grumpy middle age, his comedy shows signs of curdling.

results.headline: Finding the Humanity in the F.B.I.’s Feared Enforcer
results.summary_short: “J. Edgar” is less the story of the public face of the F.B.I. than it is a look at the private man.

results.headline: Music to the Ears of the City Reeling From 9/11
results.summary_short: Ten years after the event, “The Love We Make” documents a rock concert in honor of rescue workers.

results.headline: Romance Overnight
results.summary_short: “Stuck Between Stations” follows two would-be lovers on an overnight jaunt through Minneapolis.

results.headline: Yours, Mine and Ours, Defined for a New Era
results.summary_short: What it means to be a family is explored in Patrick Wang’s self-distributed film “In the Family,” which survived 30 rejections by film festivals.

results.headline: A Subculture of Random Hedonism
results.summary_short: The documentary “Dragonslayer” looks at the skateboarder Josh Sandoval, known as Skreech, following his return to the sport.

results.headline: A Holiday Up in Smoke
results.summary_short: The comedy “A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas” again delights in the recreational drug use of its two stoner characters.

results.headline: A Cop From the Projects and a Boy’s Guilty Secret
results.summary_short: “The Son of No One” a police corruption drama, stars Channing Tatum, Ray Liotta, Juliette Binoche and Al Pacino.

results.headline: A Sort of Homecoming to an Unexpected Fate
results.summary_short: A tough guy leaves the hospital, gets on a bus and goes for a drink before returning to the apartment he left behind, only to find it occupied.

results.headline: A Master of the Piano Whose Performances Receive No Applause
results.summary_short: “Pianomania” is a documentary about an extraordinarily gifted individual, a full-on geek, obsessed with the care of beautiful pianos.

results.headline: Striving to Be Just Like You, Too
results.summary_short: Based on a memoir by Neil McCormick, “Killing Bono” revolves around a friend of the U2 lead singer.

results.headline: What’s Behind That Mona Lisa Smirk?
